listeningQuestion.question: What happened to the man in the boat?
listeningQuestion.translation: 船上的那个人发生了什么事？

editorNotes: 本课讲述了一个有趣的意外事件，涉及了一些重要的语法点，包括some和any的用法，以及冠词the的使用规则。

dialogueText.heading: 课文
notes: The Wayle is a small river that cuts across the park near my home.
I like sitting by the Wayle on fine afternoons.
It was warm last Sunday, so I went and sat on the river bank as usual.
Some children were playing games on the bank and there were some people rowing on the river.
Suddenly, one of the children kicked a ball very hard and it went towards a passing boat.
Some people on the bank called out to the man in the boat, but he did not hear them.
The ball struck him so hard that he nearly fell into the water.
I turned to look at the children, but there weren't any in sight: they had all run away!
The man laughed when he realized what had happened.
He called out to the children and threw the ball back to the bank.

translation.heading: 翻译
notes: 威尔河是横穿过我家附近公园的一条小河。
我喜欢在天气晴朗的下午到河边坐坐。
上星期日天气很暖和。于是我和往常一样，又去河边坐着。
河岸上有些孩子正在玩耍，河面上有些人正在划船。
突然，一个孩子狠狠地踢了一脚球，球便向着一只划过来的小船飞去。
岸上的一些人对着小船上的人高喊，但他没有听见。
球重重地打在他身上，使他差点儿落入水中。
我转过头去看那些孩子，但一个也不见，全都跑了！
当那个人明白了发生的事情时，笑了起来。
他大声叫着那些孩子，把球扔回到岸上。

vocabulary.heading: New words and expressions 生词和短语

notes.toggle: n. 伤口；切口；削减；（服装等的）式样； [ 体育 ] 削球；切入； vt. 切割；削减；缩短；刺痛； vi. 切割；相交；切牌；停拍；不出席； adj. 割下的；雕过的；缩减的
n. 行，排；吵闹；划船；街道
adv. 差不多，几乎；密切地
n. 视力；眼界；景象；见解

notes.title: like doing和like to do的区别
content: like to do sth. 表示喜欢做某事（一次性的）
like doing sth. 表示喜欢做某事（习惯性的）
例如：I like sitting by the Wayle on fine afternoons. （表示习惯性的喜欢）

notes.title: so...that...结构
content: so + 形容词/副词 + that + 从句，表示'如此...以致于...'
例如：The ball struck him so hard that he nearly fell into the water.
如果是名词，则用such + a/an + 名词 + that...

notes.title: some和any的用法
content: some通常用于肯定句，any通常用于否定句和疑问句
some在表示邀请或期望得到肯定回答时，可以用在疑问句中
例如：Some children were playing games（肯定句用some）
there weren't any in sight（否定句用any）

notes.title: 定冠词the的使用
content: 在特指的河流、山脉等前要用the
例如：The Wayle is a small river...
在表示世界上独一无二的事物前通常要用the
在复合词形式的国名前要用the

notes.example: The river cuts across the park. (这条河横穿过公园。)
Some people on the bank called out to the man. (岸上的人向那个人大声喊叫。)
There weren't any children in sight. (看不到任何孩子。)
I went and sat on the river bank as usual. (我像往常一样去河边坐着。)

multipleChoice.question: Why didn't the man in the boat hear people shouting?
options: Because he was too far away
Because they didn't shout loud enough
Because he was not paying attention
multipleChoice.explanation: 课文只说他没有听见（did not hear them），没有具体说明原因。

multipleChoice.question: What did the man do after he realized what had happened?
options: He laughed and threw the ball back
multipleChoice.explanation: 课文说他笑了，并把球扔回岸上（The man laughed... and threw the ball back）。

The children were not _____ when I turned to look at them.

notes.title: 语言点拓展
notes.content: cut这个词除了表示'穿过'外，还有多种用法：cut out（剪下），cut down（砍倒），cut off（切断），这些都是很常用的动词短语。

notes.title: 文化背景
notes.content: 英国有许多河流穿过城市和公园，这些河流不仅是交通要道，也是人们休闲娱乐的场所。划船（rowing）是英国人特别喜爱的一项水上运动。
